p: In the case of the anti-inflammatory activity, both EOs were not able to elicit a proinflammatory response because the levels of IL-6 and TNF- Î± were not significantly different from the untreated control (Figures 2(a) and 2(c)). Surprisingly, the levels of IL-10 (anti-inflammatory activity) of the RO EO showed a 4-fold increase compared to the untreated control ( Figure 2(b)).
